The interaction between viral S protein and cell surface receptor ACE2 could activate the downstream renin‐angiotensin‐aldosterone system (RAAS) since ACE2 is one of the crucial components of RAAS (Figure 2). RAAS could be involved in the COVID‐19 pathogenesis and could balance the RAAS by increasing ACE2 or blocking the interaction between AngII, and AT1/AT2 could be a potential therapeutic target for COVID‐19.
